image.altText: A man with short white hair in a burgundy sweater with his arms crossed looks concerned.

props.synopsis: A tight race was the last thing ACT voters expected before this election, and not until the final days of the campaign for Bean did Labor seriously worry independent Jessie Price could snatch the seat â€” next time, the party will leave nothing to chance.

title.children: Contest for Bean brings David Smith face to face with political mortality

image.altText: Surf emu

props.synopsis: When a businessman imported emus to his private island on the NSW south coast, he did not realise they could swim for freedom and set up their own thriving colony.

title.children: Emus swam 'like periscopes' to freedom and set up life on the beach

image.altText: emergency services at a property on Fernleigh Close Windellama after a boy was accidentally shot

props.synopsis: A 14-year-old boy charged in relation to the death of a nine-year-old at Windellama has faced court for the first time.

title.children: Teen pleads not guilty over accidental shooting death of 9yo near Goulburn

image.altText: A woman with dark blonde hair pulled back smiles lightly.

props.synopsis: The ACT health minister apologises for mistakes that led to the death of Jessica Bovill, who was given a dose of sodium bicarbonate "far in excess" of what was recommended, resulting in her death at the Canberra Hospital.

title.children: Jessica died due to a hospital error. Her family was told it was suicide

image.altText: Gosford Council offers to complete Highway upgrade.

props.synopsis: A man who drove his ute onto a flooded causeway with two men standing on the tray will serve an intensive corrections order instead of a prison term.

title.children: Man who killed friends by driving into floodwaters avoids jail

image.altText: A 56-year-old man smiling and wearing glasses.

props.synopsis: The family of Canberra man Harri Jokinen, who was killed during a high-speed police pursuit on the Monaro Highway in 2021, hopes an inquest into his death will lead to a change in policy.

title.children: Family hopes coronial inquest leads to change in police pursuit policy

image.altText: A pharmacist in a chemist.

props.synopsis: Every morning when Chris Lawler opens the doors of his Canberran pharmacy, he knows some of the customers wonâ€™t be coming to purchase, but to steal. A new online portal offers hope things might get better.

title.children: Shoplifters raid this pharmacy â€˜dailyâ€™, but police are too busy to act

image.altText: A concrete building reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory", with the Australian, ACT and Aboriginal flags.

props.synopsis: A 25-year-old Canberra man pleads not guilty in the ACT Magistrates Court to allegedly performing a Nazi salute in front of the Gold Coast Hebrew Congregation in October last year.

title.children: Canberra man charged with performing Nazi salute outside synagogue

image.altText: A man in hand-cuffs is escorted by two police officers along a road.

props.synopsis: A case where a group of men allegedly impersonated police to break into a Mawson home appears before the ACT Magistrates Court, with police saying they believe the victim was mistakenly targeted.

title.children: Pair allegedly impersonated police in Canberra home invasion

image.altText: A woman wearing a rainbow striped sweater with dark hair in a bun sits on a couch doing a puzzle.

props.synopsis: A global shortage of ADHD medications is forcing doctors to get creative and pushing pharmacists into a "Hunger Games" style battle to secure supply.

title.children: Hunger Games battle for ADHD medication reaches peak in Canberra

image.altText: Illustration of two children playing in rain and mud for the first time, happy and jumping.

props.synopsis: Some kids had never seen a puddle until the Millennium Drought broke. The decade-long dry spell sweeping Australia delivered more than cracked earth, it changed our relationship with water.

title.children: The legacy of Australiaâ€™s worst drought lives on in our bathrooms

image.altText: crisp doran

props.synopsis: The case of a child sex offender who was on the run for three decades has led to revelations of links between paedophiles who worked at a Queensland Catholic school.

title.children: Church reported concerns about school paedophile links

image.altText: a profile i mage of tongan national Paea Teu wearing glasses who is wanted by police over assault offences

props.synopsis: A 28-year-old man who was on the run in Sydney's west after two immigration detention centre contractors were allegedly stabbed and assaulted has been arrested and charged.

title.children: Man arrested, charged after immigration detention centre contractors stabbed, assaulted

image.altText: halle berry cannes

props.synopsis: You know someone's all out of runway for their cause when they start throwing around words like "decency".

title.children: Excusez-moi? Cannes Film Festival's dress code is nakedly hypocritical

image.altText: Murray Watt environment minister

title.children: Murray Watt confirms rewrite of environmental laws shelved by Albanese

image.altText: A newborn baby peeps over a woman's shoulder.

props.synopsis: The decline in childhood vaccination rates should alarm governments and the health sector, according to the peak body for doctors.Â

title.children: Why we're seeing fewer vaccinations and what we can do about it

image.altText: A giant illuminated animal sculptures

props.synopsis: Star-gazing, nude solstice swims and spectacular light shows are part of a growing travel trend known as "noctourism" that's injecting hundreds of millions of dollars into Australia's economy each year.

title.children: Rise in after-dark travel drives tourism surge across Australia

image.altText: People sitting around table and having a meeting

props.synopsis: Ukraine's defence minister Rustem Umerov has said Kyiv and Moscow will exchange 1,000 captives but a date for the swap will not be made public.Â

title.children: Russia and Ukraine agree prisoner swap deal in first direct talks for years

image.altText: Ben Roberts-Smith in a suit and tie

props.synopsis: Lawyers for former SAS corporal will likely spend the coming days pouring over the reasons for the dismissal of his appeal.

title.children: 'We're talking millions of dollars': Roberts-Smith facing huge costs bill

image.altText: A close up photo of Erin Patterson looking over her shoulder wearing glases.

props.synopsis: The jury in Erin Patterson's triple-murder trial have been given a masterclass on death cap mushrooms, which caused the deaths of three of her relatives and left one seriously ill.

title.children: Jury hears of mushrooms, medicine and mystery in the Erin Patterson trial

image.altText: A tv remote in red and white sepia

props.synopsis: Australian media has evolved from nitrate tapes and VHS into a digital age. It could come with new challenges for the world of cultural preservation.

title.children: Streaming promised a 'golden age' of media. Then shows began disappearing

image.altText: Vladimir Putin and Emmanuel Macron sit at opposite ends of a long table at the Kremlin.

props.synopsis: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy is pushing for a chance to face off with Vladimir Putin, a Russian leader known for using power plays and intimidation to dance around negotiations.

title.children: The theatrics of negotiating with Vladimir Putin

image.altText: Police tape in the foreground with trees and car in the background

props.synopsis: Two men, who both knew the woman, are helping police with their investigation.Â

title.children: Police investigating after woman's suspicious death west of Brisbane

image.altText: Pedestrians shelter from rain under umbrellas in a wet city.

props.synopsis: Heavy rain will drench Australia's east coast next week, but there will be no relief for drought-ravaged South Australia, Victoria and south-west New South Wales.

title.children: First taste of winter with upcoming temperature drop after warm autumn

image.altText: Debris of an aircraft lie at the backyard of a house in Kashmir

props.synopsis: A racist parody mocking India's fighter jet losses has gone viral in China, exposing deep nationalist sentiment and growing online hostility toward India.

title.children: Nationalist Chinese parody sparks outrage online

image.altText: Salman Rushdie faces the camera with one of the lenses of his glasses blacked out.

props.synopsis: Hadi Matar, 27, received the maximum possible sentence after stabbing the 77-year-old author ten times on a stage in New York in 2022.Â

title.children: Man who stabbed Salman Rushdie in eye sentenced to 25 years' prison

image.altText: Women and children carrying bottles and bags walk along a dusty road among flattened and wrecked buildings.

props.synopsis: The strikes follow days of similar attacks, after Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu vowed to step up Israel's use of force in the territory to destroy Hamas.

title.children: Israeli strikes kill at least 82 Gazans as Trump says 'a lot of people are starving'

image.altText: A middle-aged bald man in a suit with glasses looks upset.

image.altText: A man in a black shirt sitting in a kayak with one arm in the air and the australian flag flying

props.synopsis: Two row boats have begun the journey from WA's north-west coast to Africa, in what crew members say is the ultimate physical and mental challenge.

title.children: Two rowing teams attempt world records crossing Indian Ocean

image.altText: Two hands hold open cut mango.

props.synopsis: Scientists in Queensland are striving to breed the perfect Aussie mango by combining decades of genetic research with sensory science, selecting for flavour, aroma, texture, and disease resistance.

title.children: Why your next favourite mango might take 25 years to grow

image.altText: A plate with yellow and white stripes on the border with a serving of kale and olive pesto bucatini with haloumi crumbs.

image.altText: Three singers on stage at Eurovision with people in towels dancing around them

props.synopsis: The international spectacle that is the Eurovision Song Contest is wrapping up this weekend. Here's how to catch the grand final.

title.children: Your pocket guide to the 2025 Eurovision grand final

image.altText: The exterior of a UTAS building.

props.synopsis: Tasmania's only university has proposed restructures and staff redundancies amid falling enrolments in arts and humanities subjects.

title.children: UTAS flags staff cuts, restructure amid falling enrolments

image.altText: Owner of store, Leanne standing in front of the store. Licola general store board in sight.

props.synopsis: Located in Victoria's high country, Licola General Store is a local institution. But after the current shopkeeper's lease was not renewed, residents are concerned they will lose their social hub.

title.children: Shopkeeper's high country dreams shattered as lease terminated

image.altText: 'Yes stadium' and 'No stadium' stickers composite image.

props.synopsis: To build, or not to build Hobart's stadium at Macquarie Point â€” that question is no doubt weighing heavily on the minds of candidates in the Tasmanian upper house elections, with a vote by those who are successful set to determine the fate of the project.

title.children: Clock ticking on decision for Hobart stadium future
